perturbation.original_text:
The Buyer shall open an irrevocable letter of credit with the bank within 30 days after signing the contract, in favor of the Seller, for 100% value
of the total contract value.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Buyer shall open an irrevocable letter of credit with the bank within 60 days after signing the contract, in favor of the Seller, for 100% value
of the total contract value.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the payment terms. Section 11 now states the letter of credit must be opened within 60 days, conflicting with the original requirement of 30 days, creating uncertainty and potential for disputes.

perturbation.original_text: The Letter of Credit shall be valid until 90 days after the latest shipment is effected.
perturbation.changed_text: The Letter of Credit shall be valid until 60 days after the latest shipment is effected.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract states that the Letter of Credit should be valid for 90 days after shipment, however, now it has been changed to 60 days. This in-text contradiction creates conflict and uncertainty in payment deadlines, because the buyer may expect 90 days, and the seller expects 60 days, making the contract dubious.

perturbation.original_text:
Within 7 days after the arrival of the goods at destination, should the quality, specification, or quantity be found not in conformity
with the stipulations of the Contract except those claims for which the insurance company or the owners of the vessel are liable, the Buyers, on the
strength of the Inspection Certificate issued by the China Commodity Inspection Bureau, have the right to claim for replacement with new goods, or
for compensation, and all the expenses (such as inspection charges, freight for returning the goods and for sending the replacement, insurance
premium, storage and loading and unloading charges etc.) shall be borne by the Sellers.
perturbation.changed_text:
Within 30 days after the arrival of the goods at destination, should the quality, specification, or quantity be found not in conformity
with the stipulations of the Contract except those claims for which the insurance company or the owners of the vessel are liable, the Buyers, on the
strength of the Inspection Certificate issued by the China Commodity Inspection Bureau, have the right to claim for replacement with new goods, or
for compensation, and all the expenses (such as inspection charges, freight for returning the goods and for sending the replacement, insurance
premium, storage and loading and unloading charges etc.) shall be borne by the Sellers.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract sets the claims period for 7 days. With this change, the claims period is now 30 days. This in-text contradiction introduces ambiguity in the time available for the buyer to raise a claim for any discrepancies in the delivered goods.
